Running Eclipse 3.0 M9 on Win 2K

When the column size is changed in the Memory View, the cursor position changes 
unexpectedly after the reformat is completed.  There must be some changes the 
M9 causing the calculation of the selected address to be incorrect.  This 
problem is not reproducible on M8.

The debug team has not changed the memory view code - could be workbench or 
SWT related?

I think so...  I need to investigate more to find out.

java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Index out of bounds
	at org.eclipse.swt.SWT.error(SWT.java:2675)
	at org.eclipse.swt.SWT.error(SWT.java:2614)
	at org.eclipse.swt.SWT.error(SWT.java:2585)
	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Widget.error(Widget.java:381)
	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Table.getColumn(Table.java:1027)
	at org.eclipse.swt.custom.TableCursor.setRowColumn(TableCursor.java:516)
	at org.eclipse.swt.custom.TableCursor.setSelection(TableCursor.java:622)
	at 
org.eclipse.debug.internal.ui.views.memory.ViewTabCursorManager.updateCursorPosi
tion(ViewTabCursorManager.java:775)
	at 
org.eclipse.debug.internal.ui.views.memory.MemoryViewTab.updateCursorPosition
(MemoryViewTab.java:1337)

Also got the above exception.

TableCursor from swt has added a column dispose listener.  The dispose listener 
tries to maintain the cursor posistion when the columns are disposed.  Because 
that code is run on the UI thread asynchronously, there seems to be a timing 
problem, causing it to try to go to the wrong position.

Samantha, can we just mark this as a duplicate of bug 64752? I.e. is there any 
work to be done in debug once bug 64752 is fixed?

Sure. 

*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 64752 ***
